availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John L. Davidson (Todd County, Kentucky, contractor)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, contractor and soldier. Kentucky native. Contractor in Todd County in 1860. Served in the 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as major from March 5, 1862, to April 7, 1862. Died at the Battle of Shiloh in Tennessee on April 7, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 71.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0376.
Find A Grave, “John Littlejohn Davidson (1830-1862),” Memorial #47452423, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47452423 (accessed March 8, 2018).
